column2: I am dreadfully afraid it WILL be mouse! said Duchess to herself--"I really couldn't, COULDN'T eat mouse pie.
column3: I am dreadfully afraid it WILL be mouse! said Duchess to herself-"I really couldn't, COULDN'T eat mouse pie.

column2: Oh what a good idea!	Oh what a good idea!
The top oven bakes too quickly, said Ribby to herself.
column3: The top oven bakes too quickly, said Ribby to herself.

column2: When Ribby had laid the table she went out down the field to the farm, to fetch milk and butter.
column3: When Ribby had laid the table she went out down the field to the farm, to fetch milk and butter.

column2: They only bowed to one another; they did not speak, because they were going to have a party.
column3: They only bowed to one another; they did not speak, because they were going to have a party.

column2: She sat down before the fire to wait for the little dog.
column3: She sat down before the fire to wait for the little dog.

column2: Oh, what lovely flowers!	Oh, what lovely flowers!
Just a shade longer; I will pour out the tea, while we wait. Do you take sugar, my dear Duchess?
column3: Just a shade longer; I will pour out the tea, while we wait. Do you take sugar, my dear Duchess?

column2: Do you not think that I had better go home before it gets dark?
column3: Do you not think that I had better go home before it gets dark?
